externalDocs.description: See documentation for Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

get.description: This returns an array of all agent group identifiers and their corresponding descriptions. You can use this to retrieve a human-readable equivalent of the `agentGroupId` numbers.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

schema.description: Represents the set of possible agents in which tests for a given SLA test configuration are run. Agents groups are defined by geographical location. This setting usually corresponds to the regional SLA provided to you with your purchase.

agentGroupId.description: Code representing the agent group (also called a region or regional SLA) for the test configuration. See [agentGroupId values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/sla/reference/agentgroupid-values).

name.description: Descriptive name of an agent group indicating its geographical region.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Each contract has a maximum number of allowed test configurations. Get the test quotas to find out how many test configurations are allowed and how many are in use.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

schema.description: Each contract has a maximum number of allowed test configurations. The quota object indicates how many test configurations are allowed on the specified contract and how many are in use.

availabilitySlaCounts.description: Bundles quota data for availability test configurations.

max.description: The maximum number of allowed test configurations of the specified type.

used.description: The number of test configurations of the specified type that are currently used.

contractId.description: The contract for which you want to get quota data.

performanceSlaCounts.description: Bundles quota data for performance test configurations.

max.description: The maximum number of allowed test configurations of the specified type.

used.description: The number of test configurations of the specified type that are currently used.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

post.description: Create either a new availability test configuration or a new performance test configuration, if there is an available corresponding slot in the contract's quotas.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

schema.description: Represents a configuration of either an availability test or a performance test. You can use a test object to add a new test configuration, update an existing one, or get the settings of a specified configuration.

agentGroupId.description: Code representing the agent group (also called a region or regional SLA) for the test configuration. See [agentGroupId values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/sla/reference/agentgroupid-values).

contractId.description: The contract associated with the test configuration.

groupId.description: Identifies the group containing the property. See the [Property Manager API](https://techdocs.akamai.com/property-mgr/reference) (PAPI), which provides these IDs. Required when creating a test configuration.

name.description: Name you create to identify test configurations and their associated reports.

performanceSlaTarget.description: The target performance as specified in the SLA, expressed as a decimal greater than or equal to 1.0. For a target performance improvement of 20%, specify 1.2.

testDetails.description: Contains test object location and hostnames.

akamaiUrl.description: The URL of the test object for the CDN portion of the test.

originDnsHostnameOverride.description: Replaces the hostname in `originUrl` for the purposes of DNS lookup to obtain the IP address of the origin server. Use this if requests sent directly to your origin hostname redirect to the CDN.

originUrl.description: The URL of the test object for the origin portion of the test. Use the outward-facing hostname if `originDnsHostnameOverride` is included, otherwise  use the origin hostname.

type.description: The test configuration type, either `PERFORMANCE` or `AVAILABILITY`.

schema.description: Represents a configuration of either an availability test or a performance test. A test object can be used to add a new test configuration, update an existing one, or get the settings of a specified configuration.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Returns all test configurations, or a filtered set you use the `slaTestIds` parameter to control.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

schema.description: Represents configurations for either an availability test or a performance test. You can use a test object to add a new test configuration, update an existing one, or get the settings of a specified configuration.

agentGroupId.description: Code representing the agent group (also called a region or regional SLA) for the test configuration. See [agentGroupId values](https://techdocs.akamai.com/sla/reference/agentgroupid-values).

contractId.description: The contract associated with the test configuration.

name.description: Name you create to identify test configurations and their associated reports.

performanceSlaTarget.description: The target performance as specified in the SLA, expressed as a decimal greater than or equal to 1.0. For a target performance improvement of 20%, specify 1.2.

testDetails.description: Contains test object location and hostnames.

akamaiUrl.description: The URL of the test object for the CDN portion of the test.

originDnsHostnameOverride.description: Replaces the hostname in `originUrl` for the purposes of DNS lookup to obtain the IP address of the origin server. Use this if requests sent directly to your origin hostname redirect to the CDN.

originUrl.description: The URL of the test object for the origin portion of the test. Use the outward-facing hostname if `originDnsHostnameOverride` is included, otherwise  use the origin hostname.

type.description: The test configuration type, either `PERFORMANCE` or `AVAILABILITY`.

parameters.description: One or more IDs of SLA tests, comma separated.
parameters.name: slaTestIds

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Return the contents of one test configuration. Set the `slaTestId` parameter to indicate which test configuration to retrieve.

put.description: Use this operation change an existing test configuration, such as changing the agent group or adding a performance target. Set the `slaTestId` parameter to indicate which test configuration to update.

delete.description: Deletion cannot be undone. Once you delete a test configuration, you can't retrieve it or any data that it has collected. Set the `slaTestId` parameter to indicate which test configuration to delete.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).

get.description: Returns an array of the results of availability tests run in the specified time period.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

schema.description: Represents the results of availability testing for the specified date range.

akamaiTestErrors.description: Instances of the CDN test that reported failures.

items.description: This object is referenced by both the `originTestErrors` and `akamaiTestErrors` members.

agentIp.description: The IP address of the agent.

agentName.description: The geographical location of the agent used in an origin or CDN availability test that failed.

time.description: Time the error occurred, in ISO-8601 UTC format.

estimatedAvailabilityPercentage.description: Estimated time range for which no potential outage was detected, expressed as a decimal range from 0 to 1.

originTestErrors.description: Instances of the origin test that reported failures.

items.description: This object is referenced by both the `originTestErrors` and `akamaiTestErrors` members.

agentIp.description: The IP address of the agent.

agentName.description: The geographical location of the agent used in an origin or CDN availability test that failed.

time.description: Time the error occurred, in ISO-8601 UTC format.

parameters.description: Timestamp for the start of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: Timestamp for the end of data window, in UTC 8601 format.
parameters.name: end

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey

get.description: Returns an array of the results of performance tests run in the specified time period.

externalDocs.description: See documentation for this operation in Akamai's Service-Level Agreement API

schema.description: Represents the performance test results for the specified date range. Each item in the `data` array contains aggregate performance data for one calendar day.

data.description: Container for instances of performance report data.

averageAkamaiPerformanceGain.description: The average of all performance gains for the specified date. Each is the `averageResponseTimeOrigin` divided by the `averageResponseTimeAkamai`.

averageResponseTimeAkamai.description: The average of all CDN test times in milliseconds measured on the specified date.

averageResponseTimeOrigin.description: The average of all origin test times in milliseconds measured on the specified date.

date.description: The day of each summary test, expressed as an ISO 8601 date stamp.

numberOfAkamaiTests.description: The number of CDN performance test measurements included in the aggregation.

numberOfOriginTests.description: The number of origin performance test measurements included in the aggregation.

parameters.description: Timestamp for the start of the data window, in UTC 8601 format.
parameters.name: start

parameters.description: Timestamp for the end of data window, in UTC 8601 format.
parameters.name: end

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). The Identity and Access Management API provides a [list of available account switch keys](https://techdocs.akamai.com/iam-api/reference/get-client-account-switch-keys).
parameters.name: accountSwitchKey
